pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:0.5: 43. The training rule on with a mouthful
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six spoke with food in their mouths. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.3.1: “‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.4: One should not speak with food in one’s mouth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, speaks with food in his mouth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk43:1.9: The third training rule is finished.
